clm_ac4209f455.statement: Models can store additional features in superposition by tolerating some interference.
clm_ac4209f455.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_d4179e9d92.statement: Models can perform computation while in superposition, specifically putting simple circuits computing the absolute value function in superposition.
clm_d4179e9d92.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_897f0ecd56.statement: The neural networks we observe in practice might be noisily simulating larger, highly sparse networks.
clm_897f0ecd56.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_1dcbef6be3.statement: Superposition occurs in artificial neural networks given a relatively natural setup.
clm_1dcbef6be3.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_aeed4b3d06.statement: Superposition is a real, observed phenomenon.
clm_aeed4b3d06.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_e69c9e0913.statement: At least some kinds of computation can be performed in superposition.
clm_e69c9e0913.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition

clm_2361632641.statement: Whether features are stored in superposition is governed by a phase change.
clm_2361632641.source_title: Transformer Circuits: Toy Models of Superposition
